[右]
Phono-semantic compound ( 形聲 / 形声 , OC *ɢʷɯʔ, *ɢʷɯs ): phonetic 又 ( OC *ɢʷɯs ) + semantic 口 . Originally written as 又 as a phonetic loan in the oracle bone script; in bronze inscriptions, a meaningless 口 component was added as a distinguishing mark.

[石]
Pictogram ( 象形 ): a stone beneath a cliff ( 厂 ). The cliff was subsequently distorted into 丆 ; compare 叚 , 段 as well as 度 , 席 .
Alternatively, a cave set into the side of a cliff or mountain.
